Summary: The 3 West Club offers a convenient location near Rockefeller Center and St. Patrick's Cathedral, with clean, decent rooms equipped with flat-panel LCD TVs and digital cable. It is situated within the Republican National Women's Club and provides a more traditional experience without typical chain hotel amenities like room service.

The 414 Hotel is described as a charming, European-style hotel with modern furnishings, flat-screen TVs, and updated bathrooms; it is located in two renovated New York townhouses with a brownstone facade. The hotel features a small interior courtyard and a breakfast area with a long table brightened by flowers.

60 Thompson is a stylish boutique hotel in SoHo with a modern design, dark wood accents, and rooms featuring Frette linens and Fresh toiletries. Some reviewers found the hotel a little worn around the edges and noted the small room sizes, but the location, rooftop bar, and restaurant were generally well-received.
6 Columbus is a modern, boutique hotel with rooms featuring contemporary minimalist decor and artwork. It offers a mix of modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs, iPod docks, and Kiehl's toiletries.
70 Park Avenue Hotel is a boutique hotel with small, modern rooms, L'Occitane toiletries, and iPod docking stations. The rooms are decorated with a grandma chic style.

The Ace Hotel blends modern design with old building charm, featuring modern bathrooms and maintaining the original prewar style with brass fixtures. Rooms include features such as SMEG fridges, guitars, record players, and unique, eclectic decor.

The Affinia 50 is a fairly compact but luxurious hotel that was previously an apartment building. Rooms are described as spacious, clean, and well-equipped, with comfortable beds and options for kitchenettes and balconies.

The Affinia Dumont's furniture was modern with a gym and updated lobby, while other reviewers mention the hotel lobby, elevators and carpets are dated and in need of some steam cleaning, offering views of the Chrysler Building. The room decor is mentioned by one reviewer as 70's styled.

The Affinia Gardens, formerly the Lyden Gardens, offers recently renovated, modern suites with kitchens, aiming for a tranquil atmosphere on Manhattan's Upper East Side. The hotel has also been described as combining the warmth of a European pension with understated sophistication.
The hotel is an older style building with a modern lobby, but the rooms are outdated. Some guests describe the Art Deco theme as elegant, while others find the furniture old and beaten.

The Affinia Shelburne, renovated in a modern style, maintains a classy and chic atmosphere while offering spacious rooms and suites, some with Empire State Building views. Reviewers note the presence of Aveda bath products, comfortable beds with a pillow menu, and balconies in some suites, which contribute to a luxurious and comfortable experience.

AKA United Nations offers modern and luxurious apartments with features like full kitchens, separate lounge areas, and modern d√©cor. The hotel provides complimentary breakfast, internet access, and a 24-hour gym.

The Algonquin Hotel is a historic hotel with a charming, old-world atmosphere, featuring a mix of antique furniture and modern amenities like flat-screen TVs, and New Yorker cartoon wallpaper in the hallways; the rooms are small, but clean and well-maintained. Some reviewers note the hotel has been renovated.

Based on the reviews, the Americana Inn is a budget-friendly hotel with basic amenities and small rooms, but the location is central. Some reviewers mention recent renovations and modern features like flat-screen TVs, but overall, the hotel is more practical than luxurious.
The Amsterdam Court Hotel features modern designed rooms and a snappy little lobby. Some reviewers describe it as having a European ambiance.
Astor on the Park is in an old building that has been renovated and has modern bathrooms. The rooms are small and may have marble tiled walls.
The Bedford Hotel has a small, nicely decorated lobby. It has an older style, quaint old fittings, and old-world charm.

The Beekman Tower Hotel is an Art Deco building with spacious suites and a rooftop restaurant with city views. The rooms have a kitchen and are generally clean, though some guests found the furniture and decor to be outdated.

The Belleclaire Hotel is a stylish, comfortable, and stylish hotel with modern and sleek rooms in a charming historic building. Some rooms feature flat-screen TVs, iPod docking stations, hardwood floors, and modern decor.
The Bentley Hotel has modern and clean rooms, with some offering great views of the East River and the Queensboro Bridge. It has boutique-like feeling, with modern, fashionable rooms.

The Best Western Bowery Hanbee is described as a new, modern, and stylish hotel with sleek rooms and bathrooms, often featuring hardwood floors and flat-screen TVs. Some reviewers mention the design being a bit heavy on dark wood and (faux?) marble.

The hotel has been described as modern and clean, with new furnishings and granite floors in the bathroom. Some reviewers have described the Best Western Convention Center Hotel as having a small boutique feeling.

The Best Western Hospitality House is a converted apartment building with spacious rooms including kitchens, living rooms, and separate bedrooms, but some reviewers note the furnishings and fittings are dated. Recent renovations have been made to some of the rooms and lobby.

The Seaport Inn is described as charming and tastefully decorated, with a cozy feel and old charm. The hotel features traditionally presented rooms, some with views of the Brooklyn Bridge, and is located in an old brick building on cobblestone streets.

The Blue Moon Hotel is a renovated tenement building on the Lower East Side with rooms named after 1930s and 1940s celebrities, blending historical architecture with modern amenities like flat-screen TVs and free WiFi. The hotel features a lobby with art, decorative floor tiles, and cozy seating areas, offering a continental breakfast and complimentary wine upon arrival.

I am sorry, I cannot provide information about hotels that blend modern luxury with traditional charm as the reviews do not contain related information. However, The Broadway Plaza Hotel offers clean and spacious rooms at a reasonable price, with friendly staff and a convenient location near the subway. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.

Some rooms have been renovated with fancy bathroom fixtures, while others are more like ordinary nice New York apartments, with hardwood floors and excellent beds and linens. The hotel is known for its art deco lobby with lighting in the floor and designer furniture.
The hotel is brand new with clean and well-equipped rooms that include a full-size refrigerator, microwave, and a 42" flat-screen TV. Rooms are studio suites with a mini-kitchen and cozy decor.

I am sorry, but based on the reviews, this hotel is a budget hotel that is known for its unique, artsy, and funky style, rather than modern luxury and traditional charm. The rooms are individually decorated by artists, but the hotel is also described as old, worn, and not for travelers who prefer a more upscale experience.

The Carvi Hotel is a new, renovated boutique hotel with modern facilities such as a fridge, safety deposit box, flat-screen TV, and marble bathroom. The rooms have light wood furnishings, feather pillows, individual temperature controls, and mini bars (though some reviews mention these were not yet stocked).

The Casablanca Hotel is a small boutique hotel with a Moroccan-themed decor that is described as clean and tastefully decorated, blending charm with its central location near Times Square. Reviews mention modern bathrooms and comfortable rooms with amenities, with the hotel being recently renovated, offering a second-floor common room with complimentary breakfast, wine, cheese, and snacks.

Chambers Hotel is a stylish, modern boutique hotel with industrial-chic decor and art pieces throughout. Rooms feature amenities like drawing paper with colored pencils, unique lighting, and Bumble & Bumble bath products.

Chelsea Lodge is a converted brownstone with quirky, cozy rooms decorated in an eclectic old American country classic style, featuring wooden floors and new amenities like flatscreen TVs. Some rooms have kitchenettes and garden access.

Chelsea Pines Inn is a charming, movie-themed hotel with rooms decorated with vintage posters, offering a cozy atmosphere. Some rooms feature modern amenities like flat-screen TVs and iPod docks, while the building itself retains its historic character as a converted five-story walk-up.

The Chelsea Savoy is described as a budget-friendly, no-frills hotel with clean, recently remodeled rooms and bathrooms, offering a complimentary continental breakfast. The rooms feature basic "Ikea" type furnishings, and some have refrigerators; newspapers are delivered to rooms, and wireless internet is available for a fee.

The City Club Hotel blends an eclectic style with an old-city feel, incorporating modern decorations and amenities like hidden TVs, iPod docking stations, and Hermes bath products. Some rooms feature marble bathrooms, and the hotel is located near historic properties like the Algonquin and Iroquois.

The Solita Soho is described as a small, modern, and clean boutique hotel with well-appointed rooms featuring flat-screen TVs, comfortable beds, and renovated bathrooms. Some reviews mention a blend of modern design with touches like marble bathrooms and high-end toiletries.

The Club Quarters Downtown offers modern, clean rooms with amenities like flat-screen TVs and free Wi-Fi, but some guests found the decor basic and the rooms small. It is located in a historic building in the Financial District, near Wall Street and subway lines.

Club Quarters Midtown has a contemporary design, modern bathrooms, and is newly renovated, offering a mix of modern and traditional elements. Some rooms have a fireplace mantle, and there is a salon with comfortable seating.

Club Quarters Rockefeller Center offers modern, clean rooms with a masculine decor, some featuring kitchenettes and high ceilings. The hotel has chrome and dark cherrywood finishes, and reviewers note a contemporary feel.

The Comfort Inn Chelsea has a lobby with marble, a cute sitting area, and a beautifully-restored, tin ceiling, and original crown molding is still intact in the guestrooms. Some rooms are newly renovated.
The hotel occupies a historic building with stained glass windows in the reception/bar area. The hotel may be a bit dated, but has a classic-looking restaurant.

The Comfort Inn Manhattan Bridge is a new, clean hotel with nicely appointed rooms, modern bathrooms, and flat-screen TVs. The hotel's location in Chinatown provides a lively atmosphere with convenient access to nearby neighborhoods and subway lines.

Some guests found the rooms to be modern with attention to comfort, and the hotel feels old-world classy downstairs. Rooms were refurbished to be contemporary while the downstairs retained an old-world style.

This new Comfort Inn has modern decor, flat-screen TVs, granite sink tops in the bathrooms, and free high-speed Wi-Fi. Some reviewers mentioned the newness of the hotel and its rooms, but also noted some issues with cleanliness and maintenance.
The Comfort Inn Convention Center NY offers newly renovated rooms with modern decor, including flat-screen TVs. Some rooms on higher floors offer views of the city and the Empire State Building.
The Comfort Inn Times Square features modern furnishings and decor and flat screen TVs. Some rooms have views of the New York Times building.

The Cooper Square Hotel is a modern, stylish boutique hotel with a library-themed lobby, offering guests a drink upon arrival, and rooms featuring floor-to-ceiling windows with city views. Rooms include amenities like iPod docks and mini-bars, while bathrooms boast unique designs with glass-tiled showers and dimmer-controlled lighting.

The Cosmopolitan Hotel is described as a nicely refurbished old hotel with humble character. While not a luxury hotel, it has been renovated with clean, modern rooms, retaining some of its original charm.

Many reviewers appreciated the hotel's great location near Times Square and comfortable beds. Some reviewers noted modern amenities such as flat-screen TVs and iPod docking stations, while others mentioned that bathrooms could use updates.
The Courtyard Upper East Side is described as a modern and clean hotel with well-equipped rooms. The lobby has a modern, hip design with plasma TVs.

The hotel has been renovated with modern rooms and bathrooms, with some reviewers describing it as a boutique hotel without the glitter. Rooms have granite countertops in the bathroom and nice furniture and comfortable beds.
The hotel rooms are nicely decorated and nicely renovated. The hotel blends into a residential/office neighborhood.

The Crosby Street Hotel features individually designed rooms with tall warehouse-style windows and oak-tree floors. The hotel's decor is described as being like a museum, blending art with a comfortable atmosphere.

The Crowne Plaza Times Square Manhattan is a recently renovated hotel with modern, spacious rooms, comfortable beds, and LCD TVs, though some bathrooms are dated. The hotel has a "homely feel" and a "comfy, homely feel" and a trendy lobby with a chic bar.

The Da Vinci Hotel is described as a small, European-style hotel with a cozy lobby featuring marble and cherry wood. Some reviewers mention the hotel having character and charm, while others note its dated furniture.

The Doubletree Guest Suites Times Square offers recently renovated, spacious suites, with amenities like wet bars, microwaves, and luxury linens. Some rooms offer spectacular cityscape views and flat-screen TVs, providing a blend of modern comfort in a classic location.
The Doubletree Hotel Chelsea is a modern and new hotel with clean rooms and beech furniture. It is located in a building that is described as tall and narrow.
The Doubletree Metropolitan has a modern and retro-chic lobby, with clean rooms and a contemporary design. Rooms have flat-screen TVs and comfortable beds.
The Dream Hotel is a modern and stylish hotel with trendy rooms and excellent interior decorations. The hotel lobby has a chic design with a large tropical fish tank as a centre piece.

The Duane Street Hotel has modern, clean, and stylish decor with hardwood floors, flat-screen TVs, and comfortable beds, but the rooms are small. It is located in the Tribeca area, close to subway lines, and offers amenities like turndown service and access to a nearby fitness club.

The Dylan Hotel is a small boutique hotel with a modern theme, elegant design, and high ceilings; it is located in a building that used to be the Chemists Club, and the design incorporates witty touches such as beakers for drinking glasses. Some rooms have cathedral ceilings and updated bathrooms.

- Rooms are spacious, some featuring kitchens, and are located in Midtown near Grand Central Terminal. The hotel is noted as clean and comfortable, though the decor is described as dated by multiple reviewers.
The Econo Lodge Times Square is described as clean and recently renovated, but with very small rooms. While not luxurious, it offers a convenient location and friendly staff.
The Embassy Suites offers modern, clean rooms, a contemporary design, and suites with city or Hudson River views. Some reviewers note the hotel's modern bar area and lobby.

The Empire Hotel has a trendy and modern lobby with rich, hip, urban decor featuring dark browns and candles, but rooms are small. The hotel is located across the street from Lincoln Center near Central Park.

I am sorry, but the reviews provided do not contain information about a blend of modern luxury with traditional charm. The reviews focus on the spaciousness of the rooms, the presence of kitchens, and some cleanliness and service issues.
The hotel features modern and big rooms with nice furniture, plasma TVs, and large, modern bathrooms. It is described as having a stylish and boutique feel, with a small lobby.
The Excelsior Hotel is described as an older, elegant hotel with traditional New York style, featuring dark wood interiors and beautiful woodwork. The lobby has marbled floors and mahogany wood.

The Fairfield Inn is a new, modern hotel with clean rooms, flat-screen TVs, and well-designed, albeit small, spaces. Some rooms have nice views and the hotel offers a uniquely decorated breakfast room.

The Fitzpatrick Grand Central is described as a boutique hotel with a European feel and an Irish railway-themed bar, aiming to be an Irish oasis in Manhattan. It combines updated rooms and modern amenities with traditional decor and a warm, homely feel, offering a quiet respite from the city.

The Fitzpatrick Manhattan is described as having luxury, charm, and Irish hospitality, with renovated rooms, Italian marble bathrooms, and a lively bar. Rooms feature contemporary furnishings and walk-in showers, while antique furniture is also mentioned.

The Flatotel has modern decor and minimalist furnishings and offers renovated and unrenovated rooms with options such as jacuzzi tubs, kitchenettes, and separate toilet and shower rooms. The lobby is sleek and modern, with a bar area.
The hotel features modern, industrial-chic decor with dark walls and stylish furnishings in small but well-appointed rooms. Select rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.

The Four Points Soho has modern, clean rooms with wood and steel accents, resembling a boutique-style hotel. Rooms feature amenities like flat-screen TVs, free WiFi, and well-appointed bathrooms with granite tiles.
The hotel is newly remodeled with minimalist decor, modern amenities like flat-screen TVs and iPod docks, and comfortable beds. Rooms are small, typical of NYC, but clean and functional.

The Four Seasons New York is a 52-story building with a modern design by I.M. Pei that reflects the tradition of New York with masonry and punched windows and a limestone tower with lanterns, while the lobby has a marble-look feel. Rooms are well-appointed with blonde wood paneling and marble bathrooms, and some suites offer private terraces with city views.

Gild Hall blends modern design with an old-school, British-club-like aesthetic, featuring details like leather headboards, plaid throws, antler chandeliers, and a library-vibe lobby. The hotel has been described as having a "trendy" feel with "modern hunting lodge chic" decor.

The Gramercy Park Hotel has a blend of contemporary and gothic decor, with rooms featuring hardwood floors, eclectic furnishings, and original artwork, and is located in a quiet area near Gramercy Park, offering a mix of modern amenities and traditional New York charm. Some reviewers describe the hotel as having a Bohemian or European feel.

The Grand Hyatt has a massive and impressive lobby, which some guests found opulent, with brown marble, giant flower vases, and a waterfall, but others found dark and outdated. Some public areas are traditionally decorated, while rooms have been updated with modern decor.

The Greenwich Hotel combines European decor with high-quality furnishings, creating a homey feel, and features rooms individually decorated in an eclectic, minimalist style. It offers a blend of comfort, elegance, and unique design, reminiscent of an Italian villa or Swiss chalet, with features like reclaimed wood, aged ceiling joists, and marble bathrooms.
The Hampton Inn features modern, clean rooms with flat-screen TVs, comfortable beds, and free Wi-Fi. It is located near the Empire State Building and Macy's, with a subway stop close by.

The Hampton Inn Madison Square Garden offers clean, modern rooms, some with flat-screen TVs, and is described as having a minimalist chic lobby. It's located near Penn Station and various attractions, with complimentary breakfast and internet access.
The Hampton Inn Chelsea offers modern, clean rooms with flat-screen TVs, and a modern bathroom, The hotel's lobby has a modernish and simple design.

The Hampton Inn Soho has a modern decor with great art-photography, clean lines, warm wood accents and nice bathrooms, with steel beams and columns in the lobby fitting in well with the historical industrial neighborhood. It aims for a more modern look, but its corridors feel like a prison with steel doors.
The hotel is described as small, clean, and modern, with well-appointed rooms and modern bathrooms. It is a narrow, tall building with just six rooms per floor.

The Hampton Inn Seaport/Financial District is described as a modern, clean hotel, sometimes referred to as a "gem" with immaculately clean rooms that are thoughtfully decorated; some rooms have patios and views of the Brooklyn Bridge. The hotel is located in a historic building and some reviewers characterized its style as a blend of old and new.

The Helmsley Middletowne is described as having "Old World Charm" with large, spacious rooms, flat-screen TVs, and a mix of vintage and renovated elements. Some reviewers mention the hotel being an older building, but with some renovations, and having a "quaint old-fashioned quality".
The Hilton Club is a hotel-within-a-hotel located on the 37th and 38th floors, offering suites with a private check-in desk. Rooms feature built-in furnishings and Aveda amenities.

The Hilton Garden Inn Chelsea is a newer, modern hotel with well-maintained rooms, flat-screen TVs, microwaves, and refrigerators. It is located in the Flower District, near subway lines and attractions like the Empire State Building and Macy's.

The Hilton Garden Inn is a new, modern hotel with clean rooms, Neutrogena bath products, and Herman Miller desk chairs. It also has amenities like free Wi-Fi, a business center, a fitness room, and a pantry.
The Hiton Garden Inn Times Square has been renovated with black and white photos of NYC displayed throughout. Rooms have granite top desks, a microwave/refrigerator/coffee maker, and easy chair.

The Hilton Garden Inn Tribeca is a new hotel with contemporary furnishings, granite countertops, and marble bathrooms. Rooms include adjustable firmness beds, microwaves, mini-fridges, and reliable Wi-Fi.

The Hilton New York features newly renovated rooms with sleek, built-in furniture, flat-screen TVs and updated bathrooms; these rooms mix modern comfort with a central location. The hotel also offers older rooms with outdated furnishings.

The Hilton Times Square is described as having a boutique feel, a modern look after recent updates, and contemporary furnishings; it is also compared to the New York Hilton as being much smaller, quieter, and more relaxed. Some reviewers note the presence of a boutique feel, an intimate bar, and modern, recently updated rooms.
The hotel offers modern, clean rooms, some with premium touches like in-room coffee makers and soft linens. Rooms are small, but are well-fitted.

The Holiday Inn Express Times Square South is a new or recently renovated hotel with modern, clean rooms, though small in size. It offers amenities like free internet, breakfast, and comfortable beds.
The Holiday Inn Express Madison Square Garden is a new or recently renovated modern hotel with clean rooms. Some rooms feature jacuzzi tubs and large TVs.
The hotel has clean rooms, comfortable beds, and is located near Chinatown and Little Italy. Some reviewers mention it is not a luxury hotel and rooms can be small and outdated.
The hotel has some beautiful elements but is old and in need of renovation. The hotel features a rooftop pool, a bar, and free Wifi.
The Holiday Inn Manhattan 6th Avenue is a new, modern hotel with small but clean rooms and comfortable beds. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.

Hotel 17 has a European style with Victorian decor, earth tones, dark wood trim, and traditionally dressed staff, and is housed in a brick building on a tree-lined street. Some reviewers describe it as quirky, art deco, and like something straight out of a movie.
Hotel 31 has old-style charm, high ceilings, wood mouldings, and a film noir style; rooms feature vintage wallpaper. Some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.

Hotel 373 is a modern, clean boutique hotel with small, but well-maintained rooms featuring comfortable beds and bathrooms with marble countertops. The rooms include contemporary amenities such as flat-screen TVs, iPod docks, and free Wi-Fi.

Hotel 41 is a trendy, small boutique hotel with a modern bar and immaculately clean facilities, offering updates such as plasma TVs and Aveda bath products. The decor is simple, nice, and new, contributing to a cozy and intimate atmosphere.

Hotel 99 offers modern, well-decorated rooms equipped with large LCD TVs and bathrooms with showers and bathtubs enclosed by glass doors; some rooms feature intricate stonework. The hotel was still under construction during the review period, with renovations underway in the lobby and some floors not yet completed.
The Beacon Hotel is an older-style hotel with renovated rooms and lobby. It is described as having a boutique flavor.

Hotel Chandler is a four-star, independent boutique hotel with a sophisticated feel, modern, immaculate lobby, and beautifully decorated rooms, blending modern and art deco styles; it has been renovated and offers amenities such as Frette linens, Aveda toiletries, and LCD TVs. The rooms are small, but comfortable, clean, and quiet.

Hotel Deauville has an "Old World" feel, reminiscent of small, inexpensive European hotels, with features like a manual elevator and bathroom fixtures similar to those in old farmhouses. The hotel is described as a traditional brownstone with basic accommodation.

The hotel features a modern, minimalist design with dark wood, cherry wood floors, and granite bathrooms, while also incorporating elements like flock wallpaper. Rooms include iPod docking stereos and Bulgari toiletries.

Hotel Elysee is a small, elegant hotel with a European ambiance, offering traditionally decorated rooms with antiques, chandeliers, and marble bathrooms. It combines old-world charm with modern amenities like flat-screen TVs and free Wi-Fi.

The Gansevoort Hotel features a modern and tastefully appointed style with rooms right out of "dwell" magazine. It is located in the Meatpacking District, close to the Highline and Hudson River Parks.

Hotel Giraffe is a modern, elegant, and classy boutique hotel in Manhattan that offers architecturally detailed rooms with excellent service. The hotel's decor features a blend of light & dark woods, granite, dark textured wallpaper, mirrors, and colorful sheer curtains.
The hotel is a budget-friendly option in midtown Manhattan that is clean and has a convenient location near the subway. Rooms are small with basic amenities and some have been recently renovated.

The Hotel Indigo - NYC features a modern minimalist design with spacious rooms, Aveda toiletries, and large flat-screen TVs, but some found it lacking traditional amenities like a coffee maker and luggage rack. Some reviewers found the hotel's style nondescript and skimpy, while others appreciated the comfortable beds and location close to Times Square and subway lines.
Hotel Mela is a chic boutique hotel with modern decor, clean rooms, and luxurious bedding. It is located near Times Square, and offers a great base for exploring the city.

Hotel Metro has a 1950s art deco theme and art deco style with film posters, with some rooms being recently renovated. Some reviewers describe the hotel as a blend of 50's art deco with 1940's "trendy" decor, making one feel like it was stepping back in time.

Hotel Newton has remodeled rooms, some with a Junior suite option, and has been compared to non-chain medium-sized hotels in Britain and Northern Europe. The rooms include new bathrooms, microwaves, and refrigerators.
The Hotel on Rivington features modern, sleek design with floor-to-ceiling windows offering great views. Some rooms include unique features like Japanese soaking tubs and heated floors.
Hotel Reserve is a modern, clean hotel with updated rooms, flat-screen TVs, and comfortable beds. It is located in a converted office building in the Financial District.

The St. James Hotel is an older, basic hotel with a retro feel in a prime location near Times Square; it is undergoing renovations that aim to update the rooms, some of which have been recently remodeled with newly updated bathrooms. The hotel is described as not fancy and old-fashioned, but with clean rooms and some marble staircases, and some reviewers mention enjoying its old New York charm.
Hotel Stanford maintains some old features such as an elevator operated by handle. The lobby has an art deco feel.

Hotel Wales is described as a quaint hotel with old-world decor, carved wooden furniture, and a lobby with wood touches. Some rooms have original woodwork and (nonworking) fireplaces, but the hotel also offers modern amenities like flat-screen TVs and Aveda toiletries.

The Hudson Hotel's lobby features a modern, urban design with exposed brick, ivy, and dim lighting, while the rooms are compact with wood paneling. It offers amenities such as a library bar and a sky terrace.

Ink48 is a modern, stylish boutique hotel with well-designed rooms, large bathrooms, and comfortable furnishings. The hotel has a funky lobby with small nooks, zebra-striped robes, and shoe shine bristles in the elevators.

The Inn New York City is a converted brownstone offering a unique alternative to traditional hotels, blending modern amenities with antique furnishings and decor. Each suite is individually designed and includes features like fireplaces, jacuzzis, and fully-equipped kitchens, creating a luxurious and home-like atmosphere.

The Barclay Intercontinental is a traditional, elegant hotel with a grand lobby, old-fashioned ambience and style, and rooms furnished with cherry wood furniture; rooms are clean, tidy and well-maintained, but may be considered small and somewhat dated. Reviewers mention that the hotel has a sense of history and aims for a bygone age of grandeur.

The Essex House is a historical art deco building with a recent major renovation that combines modern luxury with traditional charm. The lobby features art, marble, and photography that reflects the hotel's Art Deco heritage.

The Kitano is a Japanese-themed hotel with traditional Japanese accents throughout, offering a serene and quiet atmosphere. Rooms include amenities like green tea makers, Shiseido toiletries, bathrobes, slippers, and umbrellas, with some offering views of the Empire State Building or Chrysler Building.

-The hotel is located in an older building with some rooms that are old and grungy while others have been remodeled with flat screen TVs and tempurpedic mattresses. Some rooms have small bathrooms and are noisy while other rooms are decent sized, clean, and quiet.

Lafayette House is a boutique hotel in the East Village, in an old 1848 building decorated in a Victorian style with antiques. Rooms feature sitting areas with fireplaces, and some have kitchenettes and access to a courtyard garden.

Le Parker Meridien features a modern interior design, but some reviewers found it sterile and uncomfortable, with old building infrastructure and outdated rooms. Some rooms have been renovated, while others still have older features like Sony Trinitron TVs or smell of mold.

The Library Hotel offers a unique boutique experience with a library theme, featuring comfortable rooms, a reading room, and a rooftop bar. It is located in a prewar, Art Deco building near Grand Central Terminal, blending elegant decor with modern amenities like free WiFi and iPod docks.

The Loews Regency is described as an old-school property with a pleasant and cozy lobby and nicely preserved historical touches in the public spaces. Rooms feature modern amenities like large flat-screen TVs, granite-topped desks, and comfortable chairs, though some reviewers note the hotel is aging and in need of refurbishment.

The Lowell is a small, intimate hotel on the Upper East Side that combines European elegance with luxurious rooms featuring kitchenettes and marble bathrooms. It is known for its quiet atmosphere, personal service, and proximity to high-end shopping.

The Mandarin Oriental offers a blend of Eastern and Western design elements with modern amenities and high-tech features. The rooms have floor-to-ceiling windows that offer views of Central Park and the Hudson River.
There is no information about hotels blending modern luxury with traditional charm. The hotel has traditional charm but rooms are small and not luxurious and in need of renovation.
The Millenium Hilton is described as elegant and well appointed, with spacious, modern rooms and bathrooms. Some rooms offer remarkable views of downtown, the river, and the WTC site.

The Millennium Broadway features art deco design in the lobby, rooms with a modern, stylish aesthetic, and renovated rooms with amenities like flat-screen TVs. Some rooms offer views of Times Square and the Chrysler Building.

The Millennium UN Plaza Hotel offers luxury accommodations with features such as spacious, updated rooms, stunning views of NYC, and amenities including a pool, gym, and massage services. While some reviewers note the disco-style mirrored lobby and that some rooms are outdated, others praise the hotel's cleanliness and large, comfortable rooms.

The Moderne Hotel has retro-style decor with Andy Warhol-themed rooms including Marilyn Monroe pictures and silver leather headboards. Some reviewers found the hotel's style cute and funky, while others found it cheap and squalid.

Morgans Hotel has a modern design with black and white decor and stylish rooms, with a recent renovation in August. It offers a blend of modern luxury and comfort, with spacious rooms and iPod docks, and is located in an older building.

The hotel was converted from an apartment building and has been described as being like a home away from home. Some reviewers mention the decor being outdated, like something from grandma's house, or from the 1970s.

Based on the reviews, the Murray Hill Inn is described as a clean, no-frills budget hotel with small, recently remodeled bathrooms in some rooms, but overall, it is a basic hotel with small rooms and limited amenities. Reviews note that some rooms are in the basement, that there is no elevator, and that the rooms lack modern luxury.

The Marriott Downtown offers modern, clean, and recently renovated rooms with flat-screen TVs, comfortable beds, and updated bathrooms. Some rooms offer views of the Hudson River and the Statue of Liberty.

The Marriott East Side is located in a historic building with vintage woods and brass; some reviewers note it has been recently renovated with updated rooms, marble bathrooms, and flat-screen TVs. Although some find the rooms small, others describe them as spacious and comfortable, and note the charm of the older building.

The Marriott Marquis is described as a very large, modern hotel with amenities like lounges, restaurants, and shops, but some reviewers found it impersonal. Some reviewers mentioned ballrooms and meeting rooms while other reviewers found it to have an 80s style.

The New York Palace Hotel blends old-world elegance with modern amenities and features sweeping staircases, chandeliers, and a historic Villard Houses reception area. Rooms are spacious and traditionally decorated while also offering modern features.

The Night Hotel is a small boutique hotel near Times Square with a black and white, gothic-inspired decor, Bose sound systems, Molton Brown toiletries, and is known for being a trendy and stylish option. Some reviews note the rooms are small, the walls are thin, and the service can be inconsistent.

The hotel features a modern lobby with a bar and a terrace that offers views of Times Square. Rooms are described as clean and functional, though some reviewers mention that they are dated and in need of refurbishment.

Off Soho Suites offers apartment-style suites with kitchenettes and spacious layouts, appealing to budget-conscious travelers. The suites are described as clean and comfortable, with a mix of older furnishings and modern amenities like satellite TV, though some rooms may be small or noisy.

The Omni Berkshire Place features an old-world decor with extensive use of marble, old-fashioned ceiling cornices, and brass, while also offering granite bathrooms in some rooms. Some reviewers note that the hotel is undergoing renovations to update the rooms and facilities.

On the Ave Hotel is a modern, stylish boutique hotel with rooms featuring sleek, minimalist decor, LCD TVs, and marble bathrooms; some rooms offer balconies with panoramic city views. It is located on the Upper West Side, near Central Park and subway lines, in a neighborhood with a relaxed atmosphere and various restaurants and cafes.
Park 79 is located in an old building, formerly a house, with interiors that are charming and a bit on the old side. Some rooms have been newly restored with modern and clean bathrooms.
The Park Central Hotel has a trendy lobby, updated rooms, and a stone facade entrance. Some reviewers noted its old style, old furnishings, or need for renovation.
The Park South Hotel has an art deco style, a lobby with comfy sofas, and is decorated with prints of old New York. Rooms are described as apartment-like rather than classic hotel tacky.

The Peninsula New York blends traditional Edwardian-style public areas with modernized rooms featuring climate controls, flat-panel TVs, and free WiFi. Some found it to be old-school opulent, while others felt it lacked character and needed a facelift.

The Phillips Club offers stylish, modern studios, one, and two-bedroom suites with kitchens, flat-screen TVs, Bose sound systems, and attractive lighting. It combines hotel and condo living with a stunning lobby and is known for its proximity to Lincoln Center and Columbus Circle.

The Plaza Athenee is described as an intimate, European-style hotel with a residential feel, offering luxurious comfort and elegant furnishings. Some reviewers note that while the decor may not be modern, it is tasteful, and the hotel exudes quiet elegance.

The Radisson Martinique, formerly the Holiday Inn Broadway, is an older property with some updated rooms, though many find it in need of renovation. The hotel has a historic plaque as the site of the first USPGA meeting in 1916, but some rooms are tiny and lack modern amenities such as reliable WiFi.

The Ramada Eastside Inn offers renovated rooms with contemporary designs, flat-screen TVs, and iPod docking stations, all within an older New York building. Some rooms feature views of the Chrysler and Empire State Buildings.

The Red Roof Inn Manhattan is noted for its convenient location near attractions like the Empire State Building and Times Square, and many reviewers describe the rooms as recently renovated and modern. Although some find the rooms small, they are generally considered clean and well-appointed, and some rooms offer views of the Empire State Building.

Hotel 57, recently renovated, is a boutique hotel with a modern, sleek decor and European feel, featuring well-designed rooms with built-ins and frosted glass pocket doors for the bathrooms. It aims to blend chic design with the reliable service expected of a Marriott property, offering a unique NYC experience with modern amenities like Aveda products and iHome systems.

The Renaissance New York Hotel Times Square is described as a boutique-style hotel with modernized, renovated rooms featuring updated furnishings and a classy, modern/futuristic decor. Reviews mention both traditional and modern sculptural details, as well as spacious, clean rooms.
The Residence Inn Times Square has spacious rooms with granite kitchens and modern decor. Some rooms have views of the Empire State Building.
The Ritz-Carlton Battery Park is elegantly styled and blends modern luxury with Art Deco design. Rooms feature spacious marble bathrooms and harbor views, with telescopes for closer viewing.

The Rockefeller Center Hotel features modern rooms with amenities like flat-screen TVs and free internet access, and some rooms have kitchenettes with a refrigerator and microwave. The hotel's design is modern and fresh, with comfortable beds and clean bathrooms.

The Roger Smith Hotel is a boutique hotel with unique, individually decorated rooms featuring art and antiques, aiming for a homey atmosphere. It is an older property with spacious rooms and comfortable beds, though some find the decor dated and the bathrooms small.
Hotel Roger Williams is a trendy boutique hotel with modern decor, clean rooms, and comfortable beds. The hotel has an attractive lobby, a mezzanine lounge, and a gym.

Room Mate Grace is a trendy, European-style boutique hotel with modern decor and amenities such as a pool, sauna, and steam room, located in the heart of Manhattan near Times Square. Rooms feature clean lines and are equipped with iPod docks and flat-screen TVs, while breakfast is included.

The Royalton is a historic Georgian stone building with a luxurious and modern interior, featuring fireplaces and scaled-down architectural details. It offers modern rooms and bathrooms, with features like soaking tubs, rain showers, and iPod docks.

The Salisbury Hotel has an old-world charm with an old-fashioned design and decor and older-style rooms; rooms include a mix of flat-screen TVs and kitchenettes with microwaves and refrigerators. Though not contemporary, the hotel has old charm and a perfect location.

The San Carlos Hotel is described as a small, intimate boutique hotel that combines modern decor with a traditional New York atmosphere, offering spacious rooms and a quiet ambiance. It has been renovated, is well-maintained, and offers amenities such as Aveda bath products and comfortable bedding.

The Seafarers International House offers basic, clean accommodation with options for private or shared bathrooms. It is located near Union Square and provides amenities such as free internet access and a guest lounge.
I'm sorry, but none of the hotel information refers to a blend of modern luxury with traditional charm.
The Skyline Hotel has an art deco-style lobby, and some rooms have been recently renovated with plasma TVs. However, overall decor is described as old-fashioned throughout, dating back to the 1950s.

The Smyth Tribeca is a new, modern boutique hotel with minimalist design, floor-to-ceiling windows, and marble bathrooms, with a trendy lobby featuring cozy nooks. Rooms feature Kiehl's bath products, iPod docking stations, and flat-screen TVs.
The Sofitel New York has an art-deco lobby and Edwardian facade blended with a modern tower. Rooms are well-appointed, clean and tastefully decorated, with some having views of the Chrysler Building.
Soho Grand Hotel is known for its blend of industrial architecture and modern decor. Reviews mention vintage touches, artistic wallpaper, and rooms that mix rustic furniture with high-tech amenities.

Soho House New York features vintage furniture alongside modern amenities, spacious and individual rooms, and great sound systems. Rooms also include oversized freestanding baths, and are located in converted warehouses.

Stay Hotel is a modern, renovated boutique hotel with a chic lobby and stylish rooms, though some guests found the rooms small; it features a trendy bar, Aspen Social Club, with a lodge-themed space. It offers French amenities, comfortable beds, flat-screen TVs, and Bose radios.

The Alex Hotel is a modern, boutique hotel with spacious rooms, kitchenettes, and amenities like flat-screen TVs and Frederic Fekkai toiletries. Some found the furniture and decor to be IKEA-like or tacky, while others appreciated the comfortable beds and modern bathrooms.
The Belvedere Hotel has an Art Deco style lobby while some executive rooms feature marble bathrooms, marble floors, and a marble pantry area. Several reviewers describe the hotel as having charm.

The Benjamin is described as having a Beaux Arts-style lobby, blending elegance with a homey feel, and comparing to a Ritz or Four Seasons in decor. Rooms feature touches like smoothing classical music upon arrival and attention to detail with pillow menus and high-quality linens.

The Blakely Hotel is a smaller, boutique-style hotel with an old-world feel, featuring dark wood and an English Manor decor. It offers spacious, well-appointed rooms with kitchenettes and marble bathrooms, combining modern amenities with a touch of traditional elegance.

The Bowery Hotel has a vintage design with an old British touch, blending traditional elements with contemporary flair. The hotel is designed to have an older feel with wooden panelled walls, age-darkened mirrors, and subdued lighting.
The Bryant Park Hotel is housed in a 1924 American Radiator Building with gothic-style rooftops and has modern, minimalist renovated rooms. Some found it to be upscale with a cosmopolitan charm.

The Carlton on Madison is described as a stylish mix of modern and expected NY, with a beautiful building and rooms that feature a hybrid of art deco and modern design. The hotel has a grand lobby and underwent recent renovations blending old-fashioned and reasonably plush elements.

The Carlyle is a traditional hotel with old New York charm, offering personalized service and a classy atmosphere, but some rooms are outdated. The hotel features Kiehl's toiletries, and while some bathrooms have been renovated, they are small.

The Franklin Hotel is described as a charming, European-style boutique hotel with rooms that are beautifully decorated with modern touches, sometimes including crystal chandeliers and cashmere throws. It features an old-fashioned elevator and offers a complimentary European breakfast and evening wine and cheese.

The French Quarters Guest Apartments is a small, well-decorated hotel with a New Orleans flavor, offering comfortable and clean rooms with kitchenettes. It combines stylish decor with modern amenities like Keurig coffee makers, flat-screen TVs, and iPod docks, while maintaining a warm, welcoming atmosphere.

The Gem Hotel Chelsea features modern decor with a boutique feel, incorporating art from local artists in the neighborhood. Rooms are equipped with iPod docking stations, flat-screen TVs, and Gilchrist and Soames toiletries.

The hotel has a "Zen minimalism" style with modern, stylish decor, flat-screen TVs, and iPod docks. It is billed as a "boutique hotel" with a stylish design, recently updated rooms, and soothing color schemes.
The GEM Hotel Soho has modern, well-designed rooms with comfortable beds, flat-screen TVs, and iPod docks. It is located in a lively area near Little Italy and the East Village.
The Grant Hotel, also known as The Devon or Alexandar, is a budget hotel with small, basic rooms and shared bathrooms. Some rooms have been recently renovated and contain modern furnishings.

The reviews do not mention modern luxury or traditional charm. The hotel features clean and spacious rooms, complimentary breakfast, free wi-fi, and is located near Times Square and other attractions.
The Helmsley Carlton House offers spacious rooms, some with kitchenettes and sitting areas, and junior suites. It is located in a quiet, upscale area near Central Park and Madison Avenue.
The Helmsley Park Lane has old-fashioned decor and a charming, old-world style. Some found it palatial and elegant while others described it as vintage and antique.

The Herald Square Hotel, formerly the Life Magazine building, features modern wall-mounted LCD TVs and renovated rooms with en suite facilities, some with heated floors and period hardware. It also has art gallery on the walls, and boasts a detailed care.
Hotel 91 is a modern, minimalist hotel located in the heart of Chinatown. It features clean rooms with comfortable beds and modern bathrooms, with Asian accents in the decor.

The Hotel at Times Square has been recently renovated with a modern lobby and updated rooms, some of which include iPod docks and flat-screen TVs. Some reviewers describe the hotel as having a European feel from the lobby to the decor in the rooms and classic architecture.
The Inn at Irving Place features authentic 19th-century decor and handsome antiques alongside modern comforts. Rooms vary in size, with some junior suites including sitting areas and fireplaces.

The Iroquois is a small, elegant boutique hotel with classic furnishings that is praised for its luxurious accommodations, Frette linens, and marble bathrooms. It combines a traditional, European ambiance with modern amenities like flat-screen TVs and iPod docks.

The Jane Hotel has a historic building with a vintage lobby, manually operated elevator, and cabin-style rooms designed like early 20th-century ship cabins with wood paneling. It aims for a trendy, boutique hotel ambiance while retaining its historic charm.

The Kimberly is described as a classic NYC hotel with regal, recently updated rooms featuring ornate furnishings and well-appointed bathrooms. While some reviewers found the decor a bit dated, others appreciated the hotel's traditional charm, noting features like antique replica furniture and french details.

The Lombardy is a small boutique hotel where each room is individually owned and decorated, with high-end, custom or semi-custom designs that are regularly updated. Rooms are spacious, with kitchens, and the hotel is located in a central, classy area near many restaurants and sights.

The London NYC is renovated with modern decor but some reviewers felt it had cold, sterile and boring decor. It combines a central midtown location with spacious suites, but some found seating to be uncomfortable.

The Lucerne is a traditionally decorated hotel that has been beautifully restored and renovated, with elegant and well-thought-out decor, including flat-screen TVs and high-end toiletries. Rooms feature marble-topped desks, high-quality coffee and tea, and a balance between old and new.

The Manhattan Club features refurbished rooms with above-average decor, though some rooms face inward, receiving limited natural light. It is an older building that has been nicely refurbished and is centrally located.

The Mansfield Hotel is a boutique hotel with a library, fireplace, and reading room that blends traditional charm with modern amenities like flat-screen TVs and iPod docking stations. The hotel has marble floors, narrow hallways, and winding staircases.
The Marcel at Gramercy is a modern boutique hotel with funky decor, clean rooms, and a convenient location. Some reviewers mention the hotel's chic atmosphere and stylish design.

The Maritime Hotel features a nautical theme, with rooms designed to resemble ship cabins, including porthole windows. The hotel combines this unique design with modern amenities like flat-screen TVs, well-stocked minibars, and high-quality bathroom products.

The Mark is located on the Upper East Side and has undergone a complete makeover with enormous and modern rooms, marble bathrooms, and remote-controlled features such as electric shades, LCD TV, and lighting. Some rooms include kitchenettes, and the hotel provides amenities such as towel warmers and complimentary snacks.

The Marmara Manhattan offers spacious suites with full kitchens and stylish furnishings, blending apartment-style living with hotel services in an Upper East Side neighborhood. The hotel features a museum-quality lobby and modern d√©cor, with some suites offering terraces and city views.
The Mave hotel has modern decor, clean rooms, and a stylish, vibrant feel. It is newly renovated and offers a boutique hotel experience with hardwood floors and H2O bath products.

The Mercer is a chic, understated boutique hotel with spacious rooms, high ceilings, and large windows, some featuring exposed brickwork. It offers a minimalist yet comfortable style with amenities like Bose stereos, iPod docks, and luxurious bathrooms, blending modern design with cozy touches.

The Michelangelo Hotel offers elegant, European-style accommodations with classical music in the lobby, ornate Italian decor, and spacious rooms for NYC. Some rooms feature neoclassical decor, pink marble floors, and marble bathrooms with bidets.
The Milburn Hotel is an older building that has been renovated, with updated features in some rooms. The lobby has been refurbished with a delightful design.

The Muse Hotel offers a trendy, modern decor with an art deco theme and a contemporary lobby, while also having a boutique type that feels a little like home. Rooms feature iPod docks and Aveda products, blending modern amenities with comfortable design.

The NY Helmsley has a swanky, old New York-style lobby and is described as clean and well-maintained, though some reviews note that the decor is dated. Some rooms were renovated with a modern decor and large TV.
The New Yorker Hotel has an Art Deco style, with recent renovations and refurbishment that maintain its period charm. Rooms are clean and modern, featuring art deco lights and furniture.

The Pierre is an iconic hotel that has been renovated to blend classic style with contemporary touches. It maintains old-world charm with elevator operators, a functional mail chute, and crown moldings, while also featuring modern amenities like updated bathrooms.

The Plaza Hotel blends traditional style with modern amenities such as high-tech flat-screen TVs and iPod docks. Rooms are spacious and appointed in a traditional style, with the hotel attempting to recapture some of the original Plaza Hotel's charm.

The Pod Hotel is a modern, trendy, and clean hotel with small but well-designed rooms, featuring amenities such as iPod docking stations and flat-screen TVs. It offers a rooftop terrace, a hip lobby, and is located in a convenient midtown location.

The Premier is described as a boutique hotel within the Millennium Broadway, offering modern, serene, and comfortable rooms with luxurious bathrooms. Some reviewers found the hotel's common parts lacking in personality and noted that it felt like an annex of the Millennium Hotel Broadway.

The Ritz-Carlton Central Park offers a blend of old-world luxury with modern finishes, featuring traditionally furnished rooms with upholstered silk walls, thick moldings, and marble bathrooms. Some rooms offer views of Central Park, and the hotel provides amenities such as Frederic Fekkai toiletries.

The Roosevelt Hotel has a beautiful lobby that gives the impression of pre-war grandeur, and has also been restored beautifully blending charm and elegance. Rooms have flat screen tv's and elegant decor.

The Sherry-Netherland offers individually owned and furnished rooms and suites, combining traditional luxury with modern amenities. Its spacious rooms evoke an old Hollywood feel, with features like hand-painted elevator details and elegant decor.

The Shoreham Hotel features a modern, trendy, and minimalist design with a sleek lobby, and is described as a boutique hotel with stylish decor. Some rooms have a massage chair, Aveda products, and plasma TVs.

The St. Regis is known for its classic, old-world elegance with traditional decor, spacious rooms, marble bathrooms, and butler service. It blends this traditional style with modern amenities like flat-screen TVs and touch-screen control panels.

The Standard Hotel has floor-to-ceiling windows with views of the Hudson River and NYC, and is designed with 1970s-style appointments. Rooms have a peek-a-boo shower, large soaking tub, and Kiss My Face bath products.

The Surrey is an elegant, classy, and modern hip hotel that is decorated with timeless furniture. The hotel combines modern marble lobbies with hand-painted decals, dark wood tones and one-of-a-kind art pieces.

The Sylvan Guest House is located in a historical townhouse on Sylvan Terrace, in Harlem, near the Jumel Mansion. It features apartments with well-equipped kitchens, modern bathrooms, African art decorations, and a deck.

The Time Hotel is a modern, contemporary hotel with art deco styling, housed in a recently converted older building. It features boutique-style rooms with trendy decor in blues, yellows, and reds, but some reviewers note that it is starting to look a bit dated and worn.

The Waldorf Astoria is a grand, historic hotel with art deco design; some reviewers found the rooms spacious, while others found them small and dated, with the need for refurbishment. It blends old-world elegance with modern conveniences such as flat-screen TVs and iPod docking stations in some rooms.

The Westin New York at Times Square is a modern hotel with sleek, contemporary d√©cor, stainless steel bathroom fixtures, and high-tech amenities like iPod docking stations and flatscreen HDTVs. Some rooms offer city or river views and access to an Executive Club lounge.
The Hotel Thirty Thirty has a trendy lobby and clean, modern rooms, with slate bathrooms in some executive rooms. Some rooms are spacious with living areas, sofas, and large bathrooms.

The Thompson LES is a modern, trendy hotel with a sleek design, floor-to-ceiling windows, and spacious rooms by New York standards. Though some found the decor minimalist and cold, others appreciated the comfortable beds and rain showers.

The Travel Inn offers basic, clean rooms with amenities like a fridge and microwave and free parking in a central location near Times Square. Some rooms have a view of the Empire State Building, and an outdoor pool is available.

The Tribeca Grand is described as an impeccably classy and elegant hotel with old-school style in New York, featuring subdued lighting and excellent furnishings in the lobby. The hotel's decor is mentioned as a cross between futuristic and factory environments, providing an urban feel.

The Trump International Hotel offers modern rooms with amenities like plasma TVs and well-equipped kitchens, but some guests found the decor dated, the bathrooms small, and the overall atmosphere lacking traditional charm. It may offer the best of both worlds.

The Tudor Hotel, listed in the National Register of Historic Hotels, has been recently renovated, blending modern facilities with historic charm. While some rooms retain original wooden headboards and furniture, others have been updated with modern bathrooms and flat-screen TVs.

The Avalon Vincci, located in central Manhattan, is described as a clean, updated boutique hotel with updated rooms featuring marble bathrooms and European character in both decoration and service. Though some found it dated, others describe it as having "Georgian distressed elegance."

The W - The Court is described as a blend of past era character with modern flair, retaining the character of the building's construction period while offering a peaceful, modern hotel experience. Rooms aim to be upscale and chic, with a darkish, hip interior.

The W Tuscany, located in an older building, is described as stylish and well-designed, blending modern decor with existing architecture. Some reviewers noted vintage character in bathrooms or older design features alongside modern updates.
The W Times Square is a trendy, modern hotel with chic decor and comfortable beds. The hotel is located in the heart of Times Square.

The W Union Square occupies a historical building, blending modern decor with elements of the original structure like tiled floors. Rooms feature stylish, modern designs, and some retain high ceilings from the building's original architecture.

The Waldorf Towers features large rooms and suites with antique furniture and traditional decor, but some reviewers note that the hotel is old and showing signs of wear. Some suites have updated marble bathrooms, and the hotel has art deco details in public areas.

The Wall Street Inn has a charming interior design with a mix of colonial and turn-of-the-(20th)century era wallpapering and linens and boutique old world European decor. The rooms appear either new, or newly upgraded with tasteful artwork and matching furniture.

The Warwick Hotel is a historic hotel with old-world charm, spacious rooms, and marble bathrooms that may need updating. Some rooms have been renovated with updated LCD TVs and are described as clean and comfortable.

The Washington Jefferson Hotel features a recently renovated interior with modern d√©cor, a marble lobby, and new bathroom fixtures, but is integrated into a large, older building. Some reviewers mention the hotel has older elevators and infrastructure, and pole lamps instead of modern lighting fixtures.

Washington Square Hotel is a charming, small-scale hotel with art deco touches in a historic Greenwich Village location. Some rooms are renovated with a 1930s style, while the lobby features art nouveau and art deco design with art.

The Wellington Hotel has an art deco lobby, but some guests found that the rooms are old-fashioned and in need of updating. However, other guests found the old-fashioned style added to the charm of the hotel.
The hotel features modern decor and accents, with a studio apartment feel, blonde all-wood floors, and Italian marble shower stalls. The building is described as modern and contemporary in taste.

The Wyndham Midtown (Wingate) is newly renovated and has updated and modern furnishings, spacious rooms, and marble bathrooms. It is an elegant yet unpretentious smaller hotel with LCD TVs and modern amenities, located in midtown near major attractions.

The Wolcott Hotel is a historic hotel built in 1904 with a Beaux-Arts lobby, and an old ballroom; rooms have pre-war New York ambiance, with some renovated floors, and old-school character. It is located centrally near the Empire State Building, and other attractions.

Woogo Central Park Apartments, also known as YourStay, offer apartment-style accommodations with kitchenettes, varying in cleanliness and maintenance. Some rooms feature modern furniture and amenities, while others have older furnishings, and the hotel is located near Central Park and subway lines.

The Wyndham Garden Hotel Times Square South features modern decor, new amenities, and a chic design, housed in a building that may not match the surrounding neighborhood. The hotel offers comfortable beds, large bathrooms, and options for city views, alongside practical amenities like free Wi-Fi and a convenient Starbucks in the lobby.
